entry.title: you cannot cover all squares with dominos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that if you remove two opposite corners of a chessboard, you cannot cover all squares with dominos?

entry.title: Robert J. Fulton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1875, Robert J. Fulton moved Boston College by 60 feet (18 m)?

entry.title: siege of Djibo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Jihadist Burkinabè rebels' ongoing siege of Djibo has been described as a "Ukrainian death"?

entry.title: Chunyu Yi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chunyu Yi may have been the "ancient founder of the case history tradition"?

entry.title: Church of the Sacred Heart of Jesus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2010, the Church of the Sacred Heart of Jesus in Atlanta became the first church in the state to be elevated to the rank of a minor basilica?

entry.title: Robert Nimmo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Robert Nimmo's command of the UN Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan remains the longest ever command of a United Nations operation?

entry.title: Victory Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Victory Theatre, the first theater on 42nd Street to show adult movies, later became a children's theater?

entry.title: C. Jouco Bleeker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that religious studies scholar C. Jouco Bleeker believed that religions are like acorns?
